pitch_me_signals.title: Investors Open to Pitches
pitch_me_signals.description: Active signals from VC investors explicitly welcoming cybersecurity and early-stage startup pitches (LinkedIn activity only)

signals.summary: Co-Founder & Co-Managing Partner at DataTribe cybersecurity foundry. Recently active on LinkedIn with 2 posts. Founded Allegis Capital in 1996, now co-builds cybersecurity startups.

signals.ktlyst_alignment: HIGH - DataTribe is a cybersecurity foundry that co-builds startups

signals.summary: Partner and Chief Customer Officer at DataTribe. Self-described 'start-up junkie turned venture capitalist' who invests in and co-builds cybersecurity startups. Recently posted on LinkedIn.

signals.ktlyst_alignment: HIGH - explicitly invests in and co-builds cybersecurity startups

signals.summary: President of Paladin Global Institute at Paladin Capital Group. Former DHS Attorney-Advisor (Cybersecurity) 2016-2019. Nationally recognized leader in cybersecurity, emerging technology policy, and national security. 2 recent LinkedIn posts.

signals.ktlyst_alignment: HIGH - deep cybersecurity policy background, active on LinkedIn

new_funds.title: Recent Fund Announcements
new_funds.description: New funds raised by investors relevant to cybersecurity and AI (actual investor activity)

signals.thesis: Boldstart Fund VII ($250M) announcement on LinkedIn - targeting AI founders at early/embryonic stages for autonomous enterprise

Boldstart Ventures Fund VII announced - $250M AI fund targeting early/embryonic stage founders building autonomous enterprise. Also celebrated Protect AI acquisition by Palo Alto Networks at RSAC2025.
Bessemer invested in Upwind Security - $250M Series B at $1.5B valuation for cloud security startup
Claroty raised $150M+ at $3B valuation - third mega round from Team8 portfolio (following Port.io $100M and Classiq $130M)

daily.executive_summary: No direct investor signals today, but market data reveals concentrated VC activity with fewer deals and higher valuations, particularly in AI-driven sectors. The focus on fraud detection models running in milliseconds and agent collaboration frameworks aligns with KTLYST's real-time detection and autonomous security thesis.
key_themes: Market consolidation with fewer but larger deals
AI infrastructure and real-time processing focus
Deep tech regulatory support expanding globally
recommended_actions: Apply for TechCrunch Startup Battlefield 200 - nominations are open and could provide visibility to VCs focused on AI/security startups
Research Keith Block's firm (which led Gather AI's $40M round) as they're actively investing in AI-powered automation solutions similar to KTLYST's detection automation
Leverage the real-time AI processing trend highlighted in fraud detection articles to refine pitch messaging around KTLYST's millisecond threat detection capabilities

weekly.executive_summary: Strong week for KTLYST's thesis areas with multiple investors actively signaling interest in agentic AI security and detection engineering. WitnessAI's $58M raise for 'Agentic Security' validates the autonomous security approach, while key investors are explicitly seeking early-stage cyber founders and highlighting AI agent security concerns.
